item.title: Quantity Of 'Skills' Doesn't Mean Quality In Amazon Echo's Alexa
item.description: September 20, 2017 - Amazon Echo's Alexa has helped people do all sorts of tasks. Although Alexa now has more than 15,000 so-called "skills," critics say that many of Amazon's skills are low-quality.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - Amazon Echo's Alexa has helped people do all sorts of tasks. Although Alexa now has more than 15,000 so-called "skills," critics say that many of Amazon's skills are low-quality. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/20/552269857/quantity-of-skills-doesnt-mean-quality-in-amazon-echos-alexa

item.title: Rise Of The Beerbots: Is Tech Taking The Craft Out Of Homebrewing?
item.description: September 19, 2017 - Automated systems have turned the messy, ancient art of brewing into a tidy hobby requiring fairly minimal skill, and of course, a smartphone or tablet. Critics ask: Where's the craft in that?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - Automated systems have turned the messy, ancient art of brewing into a tidy hobby requiring fairly minimal skill, and of course, a smartphone or tablet. Critics ask: Where's the craft in that? http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/19/550988801/rise-of-the-beerbots-is-tech-taking-the-craft-out-of-homebrewing

item.title: Silicon Valley's Ellen Pao Tackles Sex Discrimination, Workplace Diversity In Memoir
item.description: September 19, 2017 - The tech investor dives into the lawsuit that thrust her into the national spotlight and the workplace conditions that prompted it. She says firms are largely applying "tepid diversity solutions."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - The tech investor dives into the lawsuit that thrust her into the national spotlight and the workplace conditions that prompted it. She says firms are largely applying "tepid diversity solutions." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/19/551810814/silicon-valley-s-ellen-pao-tackles-sex-discrimination-workplace-diversity-in-mem

item.title: Cities Try Convincing Amazon They're Ready For Its New Headquarters
item.description: September 18, 2017 - Atlanta, Denver and other cities are making their cases for the online giant to locate its second headquarters in their area. At stake: up to 50,000 well-paying jobs and billions in investments.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - Atlanta, Denver and other cities are making their cases for the online giant to locate its second headquarters in their area. At stake: up to 50,000 well-paying jobs and billions in investments. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/18/551773552/cities-try-convincing-amazon-they-re-ready-for-its-new-headquarters

item.title: When Amazon Was Just A River In Brazil: An Early Chat With Jeff Bezos
item.description: September 18, 2017 - Commentator Andrei Codrescu met with Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 1995, back when the company was in its earliest days. We went to the archives to hear why Bezos was betting on the Internet to sell books.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - Commentator Andrei Codrescu met with Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 1995, back when the company was in its earliest days. We went to the archives to hear why Bezos was betting on the Internet to sell books. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/18/551897282/when-amazon-was-just-a-river-in-brazil-an-early-chat-with-jeff-bezos

item.title: iPhone X's Face ID Inspires Privacy Worries — But Convenience May Trump Them
item.description: September 18, 2017 - Advocates are concerned facial scan data could be stolen, or that a successful rollout could make consumers more comfortable with less innocuous, less accurate uses of facial recognition technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - Advocates are concerned facial scan data could be stolen, or that a successful rollout could make consumers more comfortable with less innocuous, less accurate uses of facial recognition technology. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/18/551897336/iphone-xs-face-id-inspires-privacy-worries-but-convenience-may-trump-them

item.title: Looking For Analog: Old Button-Mashing Arcades Come Back For A New Generation
item.description: September 18, 2017 - "I know I didn't grow up with arcades, but ... I enjoy talking with my dad about it and it's just something we bonded over," says one 17-year-old player.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - "I know I didn't grow up with arcades, but ... I enjoy talking with my dad about it and it's just something we bonded over," says one 17-year-old player. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/18/551043687/looking-for-analog-old-button-mashing-arcades-come-back-for-a-new-generation

item.title: Apple Gets Mixed Reactions To New iPhone's Facial Recognition Technology
item.description: September 17, 2017 - Clare Garvie of Georgetown University's Law Center on Privacy and Technology talks with NPR's Michel Martin about the implications of Apple's embrace of facial recognition technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 17, 2017 - Clare Garvie of Georgetown University's Law Center on Privacy and Technology talks with NPR's Michel Martin about the implications of Apple's embrace of facial recognition technology. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/17/551670875/apple-gets-mixed-reactions-to-new-iphones-facial-recognition-technology

item.title: What To Do When Your Personal Information Gets Hacked
item.description: September 17, 2017 - The personal information of millions of people was potentially exposed after the hack of Equifax. Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with Lisa Gerstner of Kiplinger's Personal Finance about what you should do.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 17, 2017 - The personal information of millions of people was potentially exposed after the hack of Equifax. Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with Lisa Gerstner of Kiplinger's Personal Finance about what you should do. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/17/551604487/what-to-do-when-your-personal-information-gets-hacked

item.title: What It Might Take To Stop The Data Breaches
item.description: September 16, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to technology writer and professor Zeynep Tufekci about what she describes as Equifax's unaccountability after a massive data breach.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 16, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to technology writer and professor Zeynep Tufekci about what she describes as Equifax's unaccountability after a massive data breach. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/16/551467158/what-it-might-take-to-stop-the-data-breaches

item.title: High-Tech 'Bodega' Falls Short Of The Real Thing
item.description: September 16, 2017 - Two entrepreneurs attracted criticism after they unveiled a ritzy vending machine they named Bodega. NPR's Scott Simon muses on the value of the brick and mortar stores that predate the machine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 16, 2017 - Two entrepreneurs attracted criticism after they unveiled a ritzy vending machine they named Bodega. NPR's Scott Simon muses on the value of the brick and mortar stores that predate the machine. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/16/551358693/high-tech-bodega-falls-short-of-tthe-real-thing

item.title: Hacker Group OurMine Targets Vevo's Data (And Removes It By Request)
item.description: September 15, 2017 - The hacker group, which posted hundreds of gigabytes of data it took from the music video site on Friday, said that it had alerted Vevo about the site's failure to protect itself.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 15, 2017 - The hacker group, which posted hundreds of gigabytes of data it took from the music video site on Friday, said that it had alerted Vevo about the site's failure to protect itself. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/09/15/551260545/hacker-group-ourmine-targets-vevos-data-and-removes-it-by-request

item.title: 3 Female Former Employees Sue Google Over Alleged Gender Pay Discrimination
item.description: September 15, 2017 - "It is time to stop ignoring these issues in tech," says one plaintiff. They are seeking class-action status to sue on behalf of all women employed by Google in California over the past four years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 15, 2017 - "It is time to stop ignoring these issues in tech," says one plaintiff. They are seeking class-action status to sue on behalf of all women employed by Google in California over the past four years. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/15/551206265/3-female-former-employees-sue-google-over-alleged-gender-pay-discrimination

item.title: Sam Harris: What Happens When Humans Develop Super Intelligent AI?
item.description: September 15, 2017 - Does superhuman artificial intelligence sound like science fiction? Not for Sam Harris. He says it's not a question of if but when — with potentially destructive consequences.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 15, 2017 - Does superhuman artificial intelligence sound like science fiction? Not for Sam Harris. He says it's not a question of if but when — with potentially destructive consequences. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/15/547886482/sam-harris-what-happens-when-humans-develop-super-intelligent-ai

item.title: Facebook Enabled Ads Targeting Anti-Semites
item.description:
September 15, 2017 - ProPublica found that Facebook had enabled advertisers to target ads to people who expressed an interest in anti-Semitic topics.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/09/15/551163392/facebook-enabled-ads-targeting-anti-semites
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
